item.title: When Will Fortnite Servers Be Back Up? Fortnite February 19 Downtime, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite players across the world are locked out of the game on February 19 as Epic Games deploys the latest update to the title, meaning players are impatiently waiting for the Fortnite servers to return.

Epic Games drops consistent updates to Fortnite, with the Battle Royale behemoth seeing maintenance take place every few weeks, on average, and the latest update is expected to be the penultimate drop before Fortnite transitions into Chapter 7 Season 2 next month.

For all the details on when to expect Fortnite servers to be back up and everything coming in the February 19 update, Insider Gaming has you covered.

When Will Fortnite Servers Be Back Up?

Fortnite servers are down for several hours for the February 19 update, with no set time for a return. However, previous updates offer an indication of how long players need to wait.

Mid-season updates to Fortnite typically result in downtime lasting for three to four hours, so Fortnite servers should be back online after the v39.50 update somewhere between 2 AM PT and 2 AM ET.

However, the exact duration of the downtime is variable, and it can be significantly longer if issues are discovered or if there is a larger patch to deploy.

Don’t worry, though, downtime definitely won’t be as long as The Blackout in 2019, where the game was completely unavailable for two days.

  • More Insider Gaming: Fortnite Has A Kingdom Hearts Collab in Development, It’s Claimed

What’s In The Fortnite February 19 Update?

The major addition to Fortnite in the February 19 update is the start of the Lantern Fest event and new map in Reload, coinciding with the Chinese New Year.

The new Reload map features teams of up to eight players, and the ranks for Reload will also be reset. Alongside these drops, expectr new cosmetic items and rewards to be distributed during the Lantern Fest.

Additional collabs are also on the horizon, with the expected debut of Solo Leveling, alongside further details on the upcoming Honkai: Star Rail and Looney Tunes collabs.

In the main Battle Royale, the return of the Delorean has already been revealed, and there should be a slew of details ahead of the imminent return of The Seven. Additionally, expect further hints on what to expect when Chapter 7 Season 2 kicks off next month.

What are you most excited for in the latest Fortnite update? Share your thoughts with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, take a look at the rumors of an upcoming Vampire Diaries collab, and read about the return of Nitemare Island to Reload.

item.title: Today’s Strands #718 Hints and Answers for February 19, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid.

Whether it’s your first time playing or you’re a Strands veteran, today’s tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Strands, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #718 for Thursday, February 19, 2026

To play today’s Strands, head to the game’s website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of Strands. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There’s also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don’t fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website. You can also play on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 19, 2026

The Strands’ answers for Game #719 are all big-brained moments. Some answers should be easier to find from that descriptor alone. Still, if you need some guidance, just keep reading.

General Strands Hints For February 19

Without giving today’s Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This exclamation’s origins are rooted in ancient Greece, but you usually think of someone really smart, like Albert Einstein, shouting it whenever he has an insightful scientific breakthrough.
  • Hint 2: One of the words is the name of a popular organization app these days. However, it’s also not too far away from all the motion in the ocean.
  • Hint 3: A key component of your elementary school science fair project that had to be clearly outlined on your poster board.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #718 for February 19, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 19, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you unlock some in-game hints. A few starter words that may help are:

  • DOTS
  • ONION
  • POST
  • PURE
  • THESIS

Today’s Strands Answer For Game #718 On February 19, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today’s Strands below. Check out yesterday’s answers here.

  • HYPOTHESIS
  • THEORY
  • CONCEPT
  • POSTULATE
  • IDEA
  • NOTION
  • SPANAGRAM: EUREKA

If you solved today’s Strands without our answers, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #718?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 20 will be Strands Game #719.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid. The game’s original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle’s success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Destiny 2: Shadow and Order Delayed Until June
item.content:encoded:
Destiny 2’s next major update has been officially delayed until June 9, 2026.

Destiny 2: Shadow and Order will not be released at the expected time. The game’s development team announced the delay on social media. They explained that the delay is due to “large revisions” and sizable quality-of-life updates.

It was noted that additional details would be disclosed closer to the release, including the previously announced weapons-tier upgrade and other updates.

It was also stated that routine fixes and stability improvements will continue throughout June. There will also be continued portal modifiers, Guardian Games in March, and the return of a more frequent Iron Bar Cadence in April.

The team has also clarified that they will continue to provide updates on live game content, community activations, and general news on their social media channels.

Destiny 2: Shadow and Order Delay Was Previously Rumored

In January, it was reported that the game was expected to be delayed to avoid interfering with the release of Bungie’s Marathon, the upcoming extraction shooter.

Speaking of Marathon, there will be crossovers between the two games. Pre-ordering Bungie’s new game rewards Destiny players with new cosmetics, Sparrows, and Ships. There are also new shaders, emotes, and more to celebrate the upcoming release.

Insider Gaming will continue to provide updates on the forthcoming DLC closer to release.

For more on the Marathon, see the limited-edition PS5 DualSense controller being sold to promote the game.

How eager are you to begin playing Destiny 2: Shadow and Order? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Elder Scrolls 6 Powered by Creation Engine 3, Says Todd Howard
item.content:encoded:
Todd Howard discusses The Elder Scrolls 6.

During a recent interview with the Kinda Funny Gamescast, Todd Howard commented on the progression of the sixth Elder Scrolls game. He noted that the game will be powered by Creation Engine 3. Creation Engine 2 powered Starfield, and now, Howard says that CE3 will power Elder Scrolls 6 and beyond.

“That’s going to power Elder Scrolls VI and beyond… We have a game style that we really, really like, and I think people expect from us. There’s a lot of innovation to be done there still, so that when you step into a world, you feel like you’re experiencing it really for the first time, a game like that. I think we’re happy with where it’s headed right now. That’s what I could say.”

Todd Howard Says It’s Not His Preference to Announce Games Too Early

When asked about the 7 years since the announcement of The Elder Scrolls 6, Todd Howard said that if he had his way, he would never announce anything; one day, a game would just appear. However, he reiterated that they’re satisfied with the game’s current state and indicated they were about to pass a significant development milestone.

Regarding earlier pitches for the sixth Elder Scrolls game, Kurt Kuhlmann, a former Bethesda employee, noted that he wanted to incorporate elements of Star Wars into the game’s lore. Ultimately, he did not write the script. Read those comments here.

For more Todd Howard, check out his comments on which of the Fallout games he is most proud of.

How eager are you to begin playing the Elder Scrolls 6, whenever that game does release?

item.title: Todd Howard Admitted Which Fallout He’s ‘Most Proud Of’
item.content:encoded:
Todd Howard has been around the block when it comes to Bethesda Game Studios’ titles. He has contributed greatly to the likes of Fallout, The Elder Scrolls, and Starfield, so he’s qualified to speak at length about any of them.

During a recent interview, the head honcho himself took a deep dive into every game on that list, stopping briefly to explain which Fallout game he’s the most proud of from all the titles he’s worked on. That includes Fallout 3, Fallout 4, Fallout Shelter (kind of), and Fallout 76.

But which one of them is the gem for Todd Howard?

You Might Not Expect It

Out of the slew of Fallout games released in the last two decades or so (discounting New Vegas, as Todd didn’t really work on that one), there’s one that stands out for the visionary developer.

In a recent super-sized interview on the Kinda Funny Gamescast, Todd Howard gushed over Fallout 76, declaring it the post-apocalyptic epic that he’s most proud of.

In many respects, it’s the game that we’ve done that I’m the most proud of. It’s so hard to do and then maintain as a relevent game, and I think if you look across the industry, the amount of games like it that there have been or come and gone, and here’s 76 still there with big numbers and doing well.

There’s a lot of energy in the studio.

Look, people love it. The team on it, led by Jon Rush, they just do a fantastic, fantastic job, and you see the roadmap that’s planned for the game, and it gets even better.

Todd Howard also admitted that they designed Fallout 76 as a multiplayer title despite knowing that it wouldn’t be ‘for everyone’. That was always an expectation, given how Fallout was a single-player game for twenty years before Fallout 76 landed on the market.

He also stressed that more people need to recognize the work they’re putting into Fallout 76. It’s kind of a sticking point because everyone just keeps crying out for Fallout 5, which is many years away from even being revealed. But at the same time, Bethesda Game Studios has this phenomenal MMORPG that they’re keeping updated with reams of free content drops.

Do you agree with Todd Howard that Fallout 76 is something to be proud of? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Todd Howard has shut down Starfield 2.0 claims

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: WWE 2K26 MyRise Details Revealed by Developer
item.content:encoded:
A WWE 2K26 developer is providing new details on this year’s MyRise mode.

WWE 2K26 will be released in about 3 weeks, on March 13. One of the key game modes every year is MyRise. This is the professional wrestling take on NBA 2K’s MyCareer. Every year, players take their created wrestlers on a journey to the top of WWE, with each year bringing a new storyline to the squared circle.

Details on WWE 2K26 MyRise Are Starting to Be Revealed

In a new interview with TechRadar Gaming, WWE 2K26’s MyRise lead narrative designer, Sean Conaway, shared details of this year’s storyline, dubbed “The Comeback.” This year, the bones of the campaign mode remain the same regardless of whether you choose to play as a male or female WWE Superstar. In this year’s game, you play as a superstar returning to WWE after a long hiatus, something that has become more common on actual WWE television in recent years.

Your character, known as “The Archetype,” will run afoul of Paul Heyman. Paul Heyman’s main client in the campaign will either be Bron Breakker or Jordynne Grace, depending on the gender you choose for your character. Heyman and Breakker are currently paired on WWE television, but Conway says 2K had the idea to align them before WWE did, as game development takes considerable time.

“We work so far ahead from WWE that we kind of have to look in our crystal balls and try to forecast as best as we can who we think is going to be hot a year from now,” he said.

As for the decision to turn Grace into a villain, something she has yet to portray on WWE television, it was noted that the team at 2K sees a lot of potential in Grace, and that’s why they chose her for the role.

Don’t Expect the Story to Play Out Completely the Same Depending on the Main Villain

While the decision was made not to create two different stories and allow players to craft “The Archetype” as either a man or a woman, it is noted that the decision you make and the division you’re playing through will have substantial differences from its counterpart.

Also, with regard to some players feeling fatigued after being forced to play the WWE 2K25 MyRise multiple times in order to unlock the most content, Conway acknowledged that they were aware of the fatigue and noted it wouldn’t be like that this year.

Speaking of unlockables, learn how the new Ringside Pass system shakes up unlockables in WWE 2K26.

Are you excited for this year’s MyRise? If you are a WWE fan, what do you think about the fantasy pairing of Paul Heyman with Jordynne Grace? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Is Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 The Final Chapter? Poppy Playtime Chapter 6, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 is finally here, and the twisted story of murderous toys continues. However, before it arrived, plenty of fans were theorising that this could be the final Chapter in the series, with a natural conclusion seemingly drawing near.

Well, now that the game is in the hands of the masses, the answer is pretty clear, and it seems like the fanbase is pretty divided on the outcome. If you’re wondering whether Poppy Playtime will continue after Chapter 5, then you’re in the right place, as Insider Gaming has it all figured out.

Is Chapter 5 Of Poppy Playtime The Final Chapter?

No, Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 is not the final chapter. Judging by the ending of Chapter 5, a sixth chapter is all but guaranteed.

Without spoiling the ending, which raises even more questions, it’s clear that Mob Entertainment aren’t quite ready to cut the cord and wrap up Poppy Playtime just yet.

  • More Insider Gaming: How Much Does Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 Cost? Price, Explained

For fans of the franchise, this is great news, as that means there is bound to be even more monstrous cuddly toys to evade and mysteries to uncover. But it also raises a new question: When will Chapter 6 be released?

When Will Poppy Playtime Chapter 6 Release?

Although it may be obvious that Poppy Playtime Chapter 6 is a given, no official confirmation of its existence has been made by Mob Entertainment. Therefore, there’s no official release date to share.

However, chapters for Poppy Playtime have released fairly regularly, with a new one dropping pretty much every year since the franchise began back in 2021.

  • More Insider Gaming: 10 Best Horror Games Ever, From Resident Evil to Outlast

With that in mind, it’s highly likely that Chapter 6 will be released sometime in 2027, though that’s purely speculation. The franchise missed a year of content back in 2023, so it’s not a guarantee, but that would imply that it’d arrive by 2028 at the absolute latest.

What do you think will happen in Chapter 6 of Poppy Playtime? Share your theories in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more Poppy Playtime content, check out what platforms Chapter 5 is playable on.
